intro: Brachypterum thorelii, commonly known as the narrow-winged fern, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sori, which are clustered on the underside of the fronds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique morphology and reproductive structures make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
